article:
A boy loved eating sweets. He always asked his father for sweets. His father was   _  and didn't have
much money to buy so many sweets. But the boy didn't  _  this,
and asked for sweets  all the time   .
     The father thought   _  about how to stop him asking for sweets. There was a very wise man  _  nearby. The father had a(n)  _   .He decided to take the  _  to the wise man who might be able to persuade him to  _  asking
for sweets.
     They  _  to the
wise man's house. The father said, "Master, could you ask my son not to ask
sweets which I cannot  _   ?" The wise man was in  _   ,because he liked sweets himself. How could he ask the boy to stop asking for
sweets? He told the father to bring his son back in one  _   .
     During this time, the wise man  gave up  eating sweets, and when the boy and his father  _  thirty
days later, the man said to the boy, "My child, will you stop asking for
sweets?"
     From then on, the boy no longer asked for sweets.
     The father asked the wise man, "   _  did you not ask my son to give up asking for sweets when we came to you a
month ago?" The man  _   ,"How could I ask him to give up sweets
when I  _  sweets myself?"
     A person's  _  is much
more powerful than just his words. When we ask someone to do something, we must
also do it  _  . We shouldn't ask others to do what we don't do
ourselves. Always  make sure  that you are as good as your word.
